arm_group.description: Will complete 10 week stress reduction program

brief_summary.textblock:
This project will measure baseline stress among a group of youth in foster and kinship care.
      The investigators will implement a pilot program to target stress reduction by using an
      evidence-based group therapy technique teaching mindfulness skills. The investigators
      hypothesize that the mindfulness skills will help youth to reduce stress, which will be
      measured using psychological and physiological techniques.

clinical_study.brief_title: HEALTHY (Health Education Adolescent Leadership Training to Help Youth) Leaders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ages 14-21 years at time of intervention being offered, offered to youth in out of
             home care (e.g. foster and kinship care)

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe developmental delay

          -  non English speaking, not in age range

intervention.description: an 8 week group intervention to teach mindfulness skills

other_outcome.description: To use a mindfulness measure before and after intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: baseline and post intervention (at conclusion of group at 10 weeks)

other_outcome.description: to assess risk behaviors and health measures at baseline and post intervention
other_outcome.time_frame: baseline and post intervention (at conclusion of groups at 10 weeks)

primary_outcome.description: Self Administered questionnaire to assess level of stress
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Post Intervention (upon conclusion of groups at 10 weeks)

reference.citation: Jee SH, Szilagyi M, Conn AM, Nilsen W, Toth S, Baldwin CD, Szilagyi PG. Validating office-based screening for psychosocial strengths and difficulties among youths in foster care. Pediatrics. 2011 May;127(5):904-10. Epub 2011 Apr 18.

Jee SH, Halterman JS, Szilagyi M, Conn AM, Alpert-Gillis L, Szilagyi PG. Use of a brief standardized screening instrument in a primary care setting to enhance detection of social-emotional problems among youth in foster care. Acad Pediatr. 2011 Sep-Oct;11(5):409-13. doi: 10.1016/j.acap.2011.03.001. Epub 2011 Jun 17.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor of Pediatrics, Principal Investigator

secondary_outcome.description: To use a social emotional screening tool before and after intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Post Intervention (upon conclusion of groups at 10 weeks)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
